DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim study examine insulin secretion effect modifier efficacy low-fat vs. low-glycemic load diet weight loss among overweight/obese young adult 18-month , prospectively stratify , multi-center randomize controlled trial .
DOC.brief_title: A Novel Diet-Phenotype Interaction Affecting Body Weight
DOC.detailed_description: In recent year , diet widely vary composition use treatment obesity . While none diet produce consistent , long-term weight loss , individual virtually type diet remarkably well . One explanation variation among individual difference motivation behavior . However , underlie biological difference may also play important role . Previous work identify insulin secretion ( quantified serum insulin concentration 30 minute follow standard 75-gram oral glucose load ) important biological determinant . This randomized-controlled , multi-center trial aim test hypothesis insulin secretion predict type diet work best individual . A total 160 obese young adult ( 18 40 year ) assign one two diet : low-fat ( 60 % carbohydrate , 20 % fat , 20 % protein ) low-glycemic load ( 45 % carbohydrate , 35 % fat , 20 % protein ) . Participants enrol two site ( Children 's Hospital Boston University North Carolina-Chapel Hill ) assign diet group accord baseline insulin secretion status . The protocol include intensive 6-month intervention period 12-month follow-up period . Registered dietitians provide nutrition education behavioral counsel group workshop schedule telephone call . In effort avoid confounding , close attention pay control treatment intensity , physical activity prescription , behavioral method group . The primary endpoint percent body fat DXA scan . Secondary endpoint include cardiovascular diabetes risk factor . Repeated , 24-hour dietary physical activity recall interview provide process data . Metabolomic profile molecular analysis identify metabolite conduct characterize phenotype explore potential physiological mechanism . A successful outcome work inform practice `` personalize '' nutritional therapy , enhance ability select efficacious weight loss diet individual base underlying biological difference .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Aged 18 40 year . Body mass index ( BMI ) ≥ 27 kg/m2 . Body weight ≤ 300 lb . Access work telephone . Clearance write primary care provider ( i.e. , physician nurse practitioner ) rule preexist medical condition . Willing able attend group workshops ( dietary intervention ) specify evening . Exclusion Criteria Physician diagnosis major medical illness eat disorder . Chronic use medication may affect study outcome ( e.g. , insulinsensitizing agent ) . Current smoking ( i.e. , 1 cigarette past week ) . Physical , mental , cognitive handicap prevent participation . Another member family ( i.e. , first degree relative ) household participate study . Planning relocate current area residence propose timeframe study participation . If female , plan become pregnant 18 month study .
